means: 砍倒，打倒( fell的过去式 )
砍倒，打倒( fell的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He felled his opponent with a single blow.
The trees on the mountains within my range of vision had all been felled.
sentence.Network_cn: 山上我视野范围内的树木都被砍倒了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: The blast felled all structures in a three - mile radius ., 这次爆炸夷平了方圆三英里的所有建筑物.
the method for determining felled timber volume in the forestry cases ., 林业案件中伐倒木材积测定方法.
Beloved father see a cherry tree felled , was shocked., 父亲见心爱的樱桃树被伐 , 惊呆了.

entry.def: Fell is the past tense of fall .
If trees are felled, they are cut down.

example.ex: Badly infected trees should be felled and burned.
example.tran: 感染严重的树应该砍倒焚烧。

entry.def: If you fell someone, you knock them down, for example in a fight.

example.ex: ...a blow on the forehead which felled him to the ground.
example.tran: 打在额头上、将他击倒在地的一拳

means.word_mean: 1. made to fall (as by striking or cutting or shooting or by illness or exhaustion);

sentences.sentence: "the felled boxer lay stretched on the canvas"
"the downed oxen lay panting in the heat"

auth_sentence.content: Giants, once thought permanent, have been felled.
auth_sentence.res_content: Giants, once thought permanent, have been felled.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Giants, once thought permanent, have been felled.

auth_sentence.content: The charred stumps of felled trees still stand around them.
auth_sentence.res_content: The charred stumps of felled trees still stand around them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The charred stumps of felled trees still stand around them.

auth_sentence.content: A...black dog...felled me to the ground and slavered at my throat.
